headlines: Price of 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder cut by ₹135; new price list for cities released
text: The price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder has been reduced by ₹135, according to news agency ANI. A commercial cylinder will now cost ₹2,219 in Delhi, ₹2,171.50 in Mumbai, ₹2,322 in Kolkata and ₹2,373 in Chennai, ANI reported. New rates are effective from today.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Over 70,000 petrol pump dealers in 24 states/UTs to not buy fuel from oil firms today
text: Over 70,000 petrol pump dealers across 24 states and UTs will not purchase fuel from oil companies on Tuesday to protest against the lack of hike in dealer commission. "There was an agreement between companies and dealer associations that dealer margins will be revised every six months. However, it hasn't been revised since 2017," Delhi Petroleum Dealers' Association President said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: India's GDP grows 8.7% in 2021-22 compared to 6.6% contraction in 2020-21
text: India's GDP grew 8.7% in the financial year 2021-22, as compared to a contraction of 6.6% in 2020-21, as per provisional estimates released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation on Tuesday. In January-March quarter (Q4), the GDP growth slowed to 4.1%, compared to a 5.4% growth during the October-December quarter (Q3) of 2021-2022.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Vistara pilot lands plane without proper training, airline fined ₹10 lakh
text: Aviation regulator DGCA has imposed ₹10 lakh as fine on Vistara for letting an improperly trained pilot land an aircraft with passengers on board at the Indore airport. The pilot, who was the first officer, landed the aircraft without getting the requisite training in a simulator. "This was a serious violation endangering lives of the passengers on board," officials said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Samsung to shut LCD panel manufacturing over reduced profits: Report
text: Samsung is reportedly planning to shut down its LCD panel manufacturing amid competition with its Chinese and Taiwanese counterparts. As per a report, Samsung Display will focus on manufacturing OLED and QD panels, and its employees are expected to be transferred to the QD business. Reportedly, the main reason for the shutting down of LCD panel production is reduced profits.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Mahindra & Mahindra shares hit record high of ₹1,033 after Q4 results
text: Shares of Mahindra and Mahindra hit a record high of ₹1,033 apiece on the BSE during Tuesday’s intraday trading. On Saturday, the company reported a nearly five-fold jump in its standalone profit of ₹1,192 crore for the quarter that ended on March 31, 2022, as compared to ₹245 crore profit posted for the year-ago period, it said in a statement.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: CCI probing alleged nexus between e-comm firms, their sellers: Report
text: Competition Commission of India's (CCI) investigation arm is reviewing documents that suggest financial dealings between leading e-commerce companies and their preferred sellers, the Economic Times reported. The documents were reportedly found during raids on vendors last month following allegations that Amazon and Flipkart violated competition law. The CCI arm has sought time to review documents.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Zomato shares surge over 48% in May, m-cap nears ₹60,000 crore
text: Shares of Zomato have surged over 48% in May with its total market capitalisation at ₹59,052 crore after the stock closed at ₹75 on Tuesday. The stock had hit a low of ₹50 apiece on May 11. Last week, Zomato announced its March quarter earnings and reported a loss of ₹360 crore and a 75% increase in consolidated revenue.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Indiabulls' e-commerce firm Yaari fires 60% of its workforce: Report
text: Indiabulls' e-commerce platform Yaari has laid off around 150 employees, about 60% of its entire workforce, over the last 30 days, Moneycontrol reported. Yaari is planning to shut down business operations and merge with Dhani, another Indiabulls entity, Moneycontrol quoted a former Yaari employee as saying. As per reports, Yaari did not give any notice period to the fired employees.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's import of discounted Russian crude oil touches record high in May
text: India imported a record high of over 24 million barrels of discounted Russian crude oil in May, up from 7.2 million barrels in April. India has received 34 million barrels of Russian oil since the Ukraine war began, data showed. This has trebled the value of total imports from Russia, including other products, compared with the same period of 2021.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: India's fiscal deficit at 6.7% of GDP in 2021-22
text: The central government's fiscal deficit stood at 6.7% of the GDP (gross domestic product) for 2021-22, lower than 6.9% estimated by the Ministry of Finance in the revised Budget 2022 estimates. During Budget 2022, the fiscal deficit was revised to ₹15.91 lakh crore. According to data shared on Tuesday, India's fiscal deficit for the financial year was ₹15.87 lakh crore.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: UPI transactions cross ₹10-lakh-crore mark for the first time in May
text: Unified Payments Interface (UPI) saw transactions worth ₹10.41 lakh crore in May 2022, crossing the ₹10-lakh-crore mark for the first time ever, data from National Payments Corporation of India showed. A total of 595 crore transactions were recorded in May 2022, up 134.5% from 254 crore transactions recorded in May 2021. UPI transactions also breached the $1-trillion mark in FY22.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Hindustan Unilever CEO Sanjiv Mehta's salary jumps 47% to ₹22 crore in 2021-22
text: Sanjiv Mehta, the CEO and MD of Hindustan Unilever (HUL), received a salary of ₹22 crore in 2021-22, marking a 47% jump from ₹15 crore in 2020-21. Mehta's total compensation included ₹3.7 crore salary, ₹9.2 crore in allowances, ₹4.3 crore bonus and ₹4.2 crore as perquisite. In 2019-20, Mehta was the highest-paid FMCG CEO, with a salary of ₹19.42 crore.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's digital payment industry to reach $10 tn by 2026: Report
text: A report by PhonePe in collaboration with Boston Consulting Group (BCG) has said that India's digital payments market is at an "inflection point" and is expected to more than triple from the current $3 trillion to $10 trillion by 2026. Digital payments' overall share will reportedly grow to 65% in 2026 and will constitute two out of three payment transactions.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Delhivery shares surge 15%, touch their highest-ever price of ₹617
text: Shares of Delhivery rose to their highest-ever price of ₹617.35/share on Thursday after Credit Suisse initiated coverage with an 'outperform' rating. Shares of Delhivery, which were listed on May 24, were up ₹81.7, or 15%, compared with its closing price of ₹535.65 recorded on Wednesday. The shares have risen 26.7% from their IPO issue price of ₹487/share.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's textiles exports highest-ever in 2021-22 at $44.4 bn: Govt
text: The government on Tuesday said that India recorded its highest-ever textiles and apparel exports in the financial year 2021-22 at $44.4 billion. This represents a 41% growth in exports as compared to the previous financial year. The US was the biggest destination for Indian textiles and apparel shipments at 27%, followed by European Union at 18% and Bangladesh at 12%.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Israel signs trade deal with UAE, first-ever with an Arab state
text: Israel has signed a free trade agreement with the United Arab Emirates (UAE), its first with an Arab country. The pact was signed on Tuesday by both the countries' Economic Ministers. The deal would remove tariffs on 96% of goods. Two-way trade between Israel and the UAE last year totalled some $900 million, according to Israeli figures.
author: Athira Sasidharan

headlines: Sri Lanka seeking $3 bn under IMF's Extended Fund Facility: Report
text: Sri Lanka is in talks with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to borrow $3 billion under the latter's Extended Fund Facility, Reuters reported. Sri Lanka expects another round of technical talks with IMF in early June and hopes to reach a staff-level agreement by June-end. A taxation overhaul to boost revenue was announced by the Lankan government on Tuesday.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: LIC share price drops over 3% after its Q4 net profit falls 17%
text: The share price of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) dropped over 3% on Tuesday after the insurer's consolidated net profit in the January-March quarter of FY22 dropped 17%. LIC's stock price dropped 3.23% on the BSE and 3.31% on the NSE on Tuesday. The stock price has fallen about 15% from its IPO issue price of ₹949/share.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Crude oil price crosses $117 mark over EU's Russian oil ban
text: Crude oil price crossed the $117 mark on Wednesday after European Union agreed to a phased ban on Russian oil and as China ended its COVID-19 lockdown in Shanghai. While Brent crude rose $1.80 to $117.40/barrel, US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) was up $1.63 to $116.30/barrel at 6:03 pm. May is the sixth consecutive month recording rising crude oil prices.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: GST collection falls 16% to ₹1.41 lakh cr from record high in April
text: GST collection in May 2022 fell 16% to ₹1.41 lakh crore from an all-time high of ₹1.68 lakh crore in April 2022, Finance Ministry's data showed. GST collection in May 2022, however, rose 44% YoY from ₹97,821 crore GST collected in May 2021. The ministry clarified that the returns in May have always been lesser than that in April.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Inflation in EU countries hits 8.1% in May, highest since 1997
text: Inflation in 19 European Union countries hit an all-time high of 8.1% in May, authorities said. Inflation, which is at its highest level since 1997, was driven by a rise in food and energy prices after Russia's invasion of Ukraine sent commodity prices soaring. Core inflation, which excludes volatile components like food, energy and alcohol, rose to 3.8% in May.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: FPIs sell ₹45,276 cr in May, 2nd highest outflow since Mar 2020
text: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹45,276 crore in May 2022, the second highest monthly foreign investment outflow since March 2020, when the COVID-19 pandemic had triggered a nationwide lockdown. The outflow in May also marks the eighth consecutive month when FPIs have remained net sellers. FPIs have withdrawn approximately net ₹2.5 lakh crore since October 2021.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Yes Bank plans to sell pool of stressed assets to JC Flowers: Report
text: Yes Bank is planning to sell a pool of stressed assets worth ₹48,000 crore to US-based JC Flowers Asset Reconstruction Company (ARC), BQ Prime reported. JC Flowers has agreed to place a ₹12,400-crore bid against the stressed assets on sale, ensuring a 25% recovery. Yes Bank will have to invest ₹300-400 crore in the ARC as part of the deal.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Centre releases ₹86,912 cr to states, clears GST compensation dues
text: The Centre on Tuesday said it has released ₹86,912 crore to state governments, thereby clearing all GST compensation due to them. The Centre paid part of the compensation dues from its own resources as only about ₹25,000 crore was available in the GST compensation fund. Of the total compensation released, ₹47,617 crore was due up to January.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India faces low stagflationary risks: CEA Nageswaran
text: Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran on Tuesday said India faces low stagflationary risks as compared with the rest of the world. After data showed GDP growth in January-March quarter (Q4) slowed down to 4.1%, he said there's considerable momentum in economic activity. RBI's confidence to raise rates is a sign that economic recovery is taking hold, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Mahindra & Mahindra plans IPO for unlisted arms in next 2 yrs: CEO
text: Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) will look at monetising its listed and unlisted companies by raising ₹2,000 crore over the next two years, said M&M MD and CEO Anish Shah. Unlisted firms will be on their path to an IPO, he added. M&M also raised its capital expenditure by ₹3,300 crore for auto and farm equipment units.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: US becomes India's biggest trading partner in 2021-22, surpasses China
text: The US has surpassed China to become India's biggest trading partner in 2021-2022, according to the data by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry. Bilateral trade between India and the US stood at $119.42 billion in 2021-2022 in contrast to $80.51 billion in 2020-21. Meanwhile, bilateral trade between India and China stood at $115.42 billion in 2021-2022.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Vodafone Idea shares jump on report that Amazon may invest ₹20,000 crore
text: Shares of Vodafone Idea rose sharply on Monday after The Ken reported that American e-commerce giant Amazon may invest up to ₹20,000 crore in the telecom service provider. The company's shares jumped to an intraday high of ₹9.45 on the NSE. As per The Ken, Amazon had carried out due diligence on Vodafone Idea in the first quarter of 2021.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Who were the highest paid CEOs of Fortune 500 companies in 2021?
text: Tesla's Elon Musk was the highest paid CEO on the list of Fortune 500 companies in 2021, with a "realised" compensation worth $23.5 billion. He was followed by Apple CEO Tim Cook ($770.5 million), NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang ($561 million) and Netflix co-CEO Reed Hastings ($453.5 million). Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella ranked seventh on the list with $309.4 million compensation.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Zoho CEO encouraging youth: PM as he lauds his push for rural entrepreneurship
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded Zoho CEO and Padma Shri awardee Sridhar Vembu for his push for rural entrepreneurship and called him a "successful entrepreneur". "He has...taken up upon himself the task of grooming other entrepreneurs...He's encouraging rural youth to do something in this area, staying in the village itself," PM said during the latest episode of 'Mann Ki Baat'.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tata Motors gets Gujarat govt's approval to take over Ford's Sanand plant
text: Months after Ford Motor Company announced its exit from India, Tata Motors has received an approval from the Gujarat cabinet to take over the former's passenger car manufacturing plant in Sanand. The plant had ceased operations in April this year after Ford ended its manufacturing in India owing to "huge accumulated losses" and lack of growth in the market.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Tata Motors signs MoU with Gujarat govt for acquisition of Ford's Sanand plant
text: Tata Motors has signed an MoU with the Gujarat government for the potential acquisition of Ford India's Sanand plant, it said in a regulatory filing. The agreement includes a transfer of Ford India's land, buildings, vehicle manufacturing plant, machinery and transfer of all eligible employees. As per a report, Tata Motors would pay $100-150 million for the plant.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: M&M to sell its entire stake in TVS Automobile Solutions for ₹45 crore
text: Mahindra and Mahindra has announced it will sell its entire 2.76% stake in TVS Automobile Solutions Private Limited (TASPL). It added that following the sale, its holding in TASPL would become nil and it would receive ₹45 crore from the deal. In TASPL, M&M holds 3,32,195 equity shares of ₹10 each and 100 Compulsorily Convertible Preference Shares of ₹10 each.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Can't incentivise delivery agents to break traffic rules: Mahua on 10-minute deliveries
text: TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Sunday tweeted that she will raise the issue of 10-minute deliveries offered by food-ordering apps, in the Parliament. She wrote, "10-minute deliveries need to be regulated or outlawed. No civilised society can be incentivising delivery executives to break traffic rules and put their own and others' lives at risk. All for a quicker pizza."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Which countries were India's biggest trade partners in 2021-22?
text: The US has emerged as India's biggest trade partner in 2021-22 with $119.42 billion in bilateral trade, while China is at the second spot ($115.41 billion). UAE ($72.9 billion), Saudi Arabia ($42.85 billion) and Iraq ($34.33 billion) are among India's top five trade partners. Singapore, Hong Kong, Indonesia, South Korea and Australia are in the top 10 list.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Pilot observes cracks in SpiceJet flight's windshield mid-air, flies it back to Mumbai
text: A SpiceJet plane, which was scheduled to land in Gorakhpur in Uttar Pradesh, went back to Mumbai on Saturday after its pilot observed cracks on the windshield, according to an official statement. The air traffic controller was apprised and the aircraft landed safely at the Mumbai airport, a spokesperson said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: SpiceJet fined ₹10 lakh for using faulty simulator to train Boeing 737 Max pilots: Report
text: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Monday imposed a penalty of ₹10 lakh on private carrier SpiceJet, on the charge of utilising faulty simulator to train pilots of Boeing 737 Max aircraft, according to reports. The training imparted by SpiceJet using the faulty simulator could have "adversely affected flight safety", the DGCA reportedly stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: EU agrees to ban majority of Russian oil imports amid Ukraine war
text: The European Union has agreed to partially ban Russian oil imports, said EU Council President Charles Michel. "This would cover more than 2/3 of Russian oil imports, cutting a huge source of financing for its war machine," tweeted Michel. Europe is the biggest buyer of Russian energy. Russian crude accounted for 27% of its imports in 2021, according to Eurostat.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Pak says it is open to buying oil from Russia, says 'We have an open policy'
text: Amid Western sanctions on Russia, Pakistan has said that it is open to importing oil and wheat from the country. "Our policy is clear....in terms of expanding economic and trade relations, we have an open policy, driven by national interest. Wherever we see there is a national benefit, we pursue those options and avenues," said Pakistan's Foreign Office spokesperson.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Sensex jumps 1,041 points to end at 55,926, Nifty closes above 16,650
text: BSE Sensex jumped 1,041 points or 1.90% to close at 55,926 while NSE Nifty surged by 309 to settle at 16,661 on Monday. Titan, Infosys, Mahindra & Mahindra, Reliance Industries and TCS were among the lead gainers. Meanwhile, Ethos made its market debut today and ended at ₹802 per share, 8.6% down from its issue price of ₹878.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Forever 21 owner Authentic Brands Group in talks to acquire Ted Baker: Report
text: US-based Authentic Brands Group, owner of brands like Forever 21 and Reebok is reportedly in talks to acquire Ted Baker. Shares of Ted Baker rose 3.1% on Monday following this report. It added that the two companies could agree on a £300 million deal for the same. British fashion retailer Ted Baker had put itself up for sale in April.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Investors get richer by ₹10 lakh crore in 3 trading sessions
text: The wealth of equity investors increased by ₹10 lakh crore after the market indices jumped in the last three trading sessions. On Monday, the Sensex jumped 1,041 points to close at 55,926, taking the total three-day gains to more than 2,100 points. All sectoral indices ended higher on Monday amid firm global cues and the early onset of monsoon.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ONGC becomes India's 2nd most profitable firm after its record net profit in FY22
text: ONGC reported a net profit of ₹40,305 crore in the fiscal year that ended March 31, becoming India's second most profitable company after Reliance Industries. ONGC's net profit for FY22 surged 258% from ₹11,246.44 crore in FY21. The company replaced Tata Steel from the number two spot, which had reported a standalone net profit of ₹33,011.18 crore for FY22.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Up to ₹13 cr briefly credited in 100 HDFC accounts in Chennai due to technical error
text: HDFC Bank froze around 100 accounts in Chennai after these accounts were credited with a few thousand rupees to ₹13 crore. The bank attributed this to a technical error which was noticed in a few customer accounts after a routine upgrade on Saturday. While the hold was released a few hours later, several users took to Twitter about the same.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Like demon preaching vedas: FRL's independent directors on Amazon's 'fraud' claim
text: The independent directors of Future Retail Limited (FRL) have rejected Amazon's allegations that the company facilitated a fraudulent strategy for the transfer of 835 stores to Reliance Retail and called it a "false statement". In a letter, they wrote, "It is not for a company like yours to preach governance to us. This is akin to a demon preaching vedas."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Oil India records highest-ever quarterly profit due to high fuel, gas prices
text: Government-owned Oil India Limited (OIL) recorded a net profit of ₹3,887.31 crore for the year that ended on March 2022, its highest-ever quarterly net profit. The net profit is 123.20% higher when compared with the ₹1741.59 crore profit reported last year. One of the reasons behind the record profit is high crude oil and gas prices, said OIL's top executive.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Newly-listed LIC's Q4 net profit falls 17% to ₹2,409 cr, declares ₹1.5 dividend
text: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) on Monday reported that its consolidated net profit fell 17% year-on-year to ₹2,409 crore in the quarter ended March 2022. The company earned a net premium of ₹1.44 lakh crore during the quarter, while its revenue increased to ₹2.12 lakh crore. LIC, which listed on the bourses this month, announced a dividend of ₹1.5.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: The worst is behind Vodafone Idea, you just have to wait: Kumar Mangalam Birla
text: Aditya Birla Group's billionaire Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla told BQ Prime that "the worst is behind" Vodafone Idea. "It takes some time to get people to start feeling confident about a business...again," Birla, who co-owns the company with Vodafone Group, said. "We'll have to see how things pan out. I'm very positive about it...You just have to wait," he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sensex jumps over 900 points to 55,792, Nifty above 16,500
text: BSE Sensex rallied over 900 points to trade at 55,792 while the Nifty50 advanced 258 points to 16,611 during Monday's early trade. While Infosys, Mahindra & Mahindra, Wipro and Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) were among the top Sensex gainers, shares of IRCTC rose nearly 5% in early trade ahead of its earnings to be announced today.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I-T Dept starts probe against UP businessman who hoarded ₹194 cr cash
text: The Income Tax Department has started an investigation against Kanpur-based perfume businessman Piyush Jain. In December 2021, the Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) had recovered over ₹194.45 crore cash, 23 kg gold and 600 kg sandalwood from the factory premises of Jain. According to reports, the DGGI had officially shared the information with the Income Tax Department last week.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Oil price crosses $120 mark ahead of EU meeting on Russia sanctions
text: Oil price crossed the $120 mark on Monday, climbing to its highest in over two months, ahead of European Union's meeting which could lead to a ban on Russian oil imports. Brent crude futures was up 47 cents to $119.90/barrel after rising to $120.50/barrel earlier in the session. US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures jumped 72 cents to $115.79/barrel.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Sun Pharma posts ₹2,277 crore net loss in Q4 FY22
text: Sun Pharmaceuticals Industries on Monday reported a net loss of ₹2,277.38 crore in Q4 FY22, compared to the net profit of ₹894 crore a year ago. Its revenue from operations in Q4 rose 11% YoY to ₹9,446.76 crore. The firm's sales in India rose 16% YoY to ₹3,095.60 crore while its spending on research and development stood at ₹543.30 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Sameer Khetarpal appointed MD & CEO of Jubilant Foodworks
text: Former Amazon executive Sameer Khetarpal has been appointed as the MD and CEO of Jubilant Foodworks, the company said on Monday. Khetarpal launched and conceptualised several businesses like Amazon Fresh, Amazon Food and Amazon Pharmacy. He previously worked with McKinsey and Company, GE Capital and Hindustan Unilever. Jubilant Foodworks' net profit in Q4 FY22 fell 8.8% YoY to ₹96 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: IndiGo fined ₹5 lakh for denying boarding to specially-abled child in Ranchi
text: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has fined IndiGo ₹5 lakh for denying boarding to a specially-abled boy at the Ranchi airport earlier this month. The DGCA said that the "deficient handling" by the airline staff ended up exacerbating the situation. "A more compassionate handling would have smoothened the nerves and calmed the child," DGCA stated.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: US-based Joby Aviation gets 1st FAA approval for commercial air taxi service
text: US-based electric aviation company Joby Aviation has said that it has received its first certification from the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) that allows it to begin its air taxi operations commercially with an aircraft. However, Joby Aviation still needs two more certifications before it can legally fly passengers. The company has aimed to launch its air taxi service by 2024.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: If Bezos wants to get to orbit, less partying & more work is advisable: Musk
text: Responding to a Twitter user who asked him if he thought that the world's second-richest man Jeff Bezos was a good person, the world's richest person Elon Musk said, "He’s fine." Musk added, "Does seem like he's spending a lot of time in the hot tub...If he wants to get to orbit, less partying and more work would be advisable."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Tesla won't make cars in India if we aren't allowed to sell and service first: Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to a Twitter user who asked about Tesla's plans for a manufacturing plant in India and said, "Tesla will not put a manufacturing plant in any location where we aren't allowed first to sell and service cars." Earlier, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said Tesla is welcome to India, make cars for sale and export them.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Google in talks to join India's open e-commerce network ONDC: Report
text: Google is in talks with the central government to integrate its shopping services with the country’s Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC), as per a report by Reuters. Modelled around the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) project, ONDC will allow buyers and sellers of e-commerce goods like grocery, food delivery and others, to transact regardless of the platform they are registered.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Anil Agarwal meets Bill Gates, says 'his knowledge about India surprises me'
text: Vedanta Resources' billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal met the world's fourth-richest person Bill Gates during World Economic Forum 2022 in Davos. Sharing a picture with the Microsoft Co-founder, Agarwal wrote on LinkedIn, "He always surprises me with how much he knows about India and his love for Indian food!" He said the two bonded over their initial struggles as first-generation entrepreneurs.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I guess I have trust issues with Bill Gates: Elon Musk
text: The world's richest person Elon Musk remarked, "I guess I have some trust issues" with Bill Gates. A Twitter user wrote that she didn’t trust Gates, to which Musk replied, "Since Gates still has a multi-billion dollar short position against Tesla while claiming to help with global warming, I guess I’ve some trust issues with him too."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Nykaa's Q4 net profit falls 49% to ₹8.56 crore, revenue rises to ₹973 crore
text: Beauty e-commerce startup Nykaa's parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures Ltd reported that the net profit attributable to its shareholders dropped 49% year-on-year to ₹8.56 crore in the quarter ended March. While the company's revenue from operations rose 31% year-on-year to ₹973 crore, its expenses rose to about ₹979 crore from ₹725 crore a year earlier.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RBI includes 'work from anywhere' policy for staff in its agenda for 2022-23
text: The RBI in its annual report that was released on Friday stated "working from anywhere" under its agenda for 2022-2023. While it had operationalised work from home during COVID-19, the annual report further stated, "The roadmap for the year would include…To devise a policy on 'working from anywhere' for building a seamless work environment as part of business continuity planning."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Economic recovery is underway in spite of headwinds: RBI in its annual report
text: In its annual report released on Friday, the RBI while referring to the Indian economy said that "a recovery is underway in spite of headwinds". Highlighting "structural reforms", RBI said that the future path of growth will be conditioned by addressing "supply-side bottlenecks and calibrating monetary and fiscal policy support to aggregate demand and structural reforms".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Fake ₹500 notes see over 100% jump in FY22, fake ₹2,000 notes rise 54%: RBI
text: Counterfeit notes detected in the denomination of ₹500 saw an increase of 101.9% during 2021-22 compared to the previous year, as per RBI's annual report. According to the data, ₹500 notes were worst hit, followed by ₹2,000 notes which saw a year-on-year increase of 54.16%. Counterfeit notes detected in denominations of ₹50 and ₹100 declined by 28.7% and 16.7%, respectively.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: World's biggest coal miner Coal India to import for first time since 2015: Report
text: World's biggest coal miner Coal India will import coal for the first time since 2015 amid shortages, Reuters reported. "Coal India would import coal for blending on government-to-government...basis and supply...to thermal power plants of state generators and independent power producers," a letter by the Power Ministry said. This comes as India faces its worst power cuts in over six years.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Indian oil firms' dividend worth $125.5 mn stuck in Russia due to sanctions
text: A dividend amounting to $125.49 million belonging to Indian oil companies is stuck in Russia due to Western sanctions over the Ukraine war, said an Oil India official. A consortium comprising Oil India, Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum Corporation own 23.9% of Russia's Vankorneft oil project and 29.9% of the Tass-Yuryakh oilfield in east Siberia.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Russian billionaire named wife as owner of his firms day before EU sanctions: Report
text: Russian billionaire businessman Andrey Melnichenko ceded ownership of two of the world's largest coal and fertilisers companies to his wife the day before he was sanctioned by the European Union, as per a report. Notably, the sanctions which included freezing his assets and banning his entry into the EU, didn’t apply to his wife or the couple's children.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Govt to develop framework to check fake reviews on online shopping websites
text: The central government on Saturday said that in order to protect consumer interest, it will develop a framework to keep a check on fake reviews posted on e-commerce websites. As per an official statement, the framework will be developed after studying the present mechanism being followed by the e-commerce websites and the best practices available globally.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Share of ₹2,000 notes in circulation falls as RBI prints no new notes for 3rd year
text: The share of India's highest denomination currency note in circulation is continuing to drop as the RBI has not printed any new ₹2,000 note since 2019-20, according to the central bank's annual report for 2021-22. As of March 31, there were 214 crore notes of ₹2,000 denomination in circulation, compared with 245 crore notes a year ago, the report showed.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: United Spirits to sell 32 brands, including Haywards, to Inbrew for ₹820 cr
text: United Spirits on Saturday announced that its board has approved the sale of 32 brands to Singapore-headquartered Inbrew Beverages for ₹820 crore. The transaction includes brands such as Haywards, Old Tavern, White-Mischief, Honey Bee, Green Label and Romanov. Further, United Spirits and Inbrew have entered into a five-year franchise arrangement for 11 other brands, including Bagpiper, it said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk shares cartoon on freeing Twitter's blue bird from a cage, Twitter users react
text: Amid the Twitter acquisition deal being put on hold, Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a cartoon featuring a caricature resembling him freeing Twitter's iconic blue bird from a cage. Meanwhile, Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus commented, "Despite all my rage, I am still just a bird in a cage." Another Twitter user wrote, "Twitter is about to get more interesting."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Axis MF ex-fund manager fired in front-running case sends legal notice to firm
text: Viresh Joshi, a former fund manager at Axis Mutual Fund who was fired after being suspended on allegations of front-running, has sent a legal notice to the company against his "unlawful termination". Axis AMC, one of India's leading mutual funds, is facing allegations of front-running. It earlier said it has been conducting a suo moto internal investigation since February 2022.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk calls recession 'good thing', says, 'Money raining on fools for too long'
text: Responding to a follower who asked him if recession was approaching, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Yes, but this is actually a good thing." He added, "It has been raining money on fools for too long. Some bankruptcies need to happen." In another tweet, he also said that the recession may last for "about 12 to 18 months".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Adani Wilmar best-performing Asia IPO among firms that raised over $100 mn in 2022
text: Asia's richest man Gautam Adani's Adani Wilmar is the best-performing stock among 121 Asian companies that listed on the stock exchanges after raising over $100 million this year. Shares of Adani Wilmar have almost tripled since their market debut. Notably, almost two-thirds of Asia's new stock listings are trading in the red amid rising interest rates and the Russia-Ukraine war.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Asia's richest man's Adani Enterprises to buy 50% stake in General Aeronautics
text: Asia's richest man Gautam Adani's Adani Enterprises on Friday announced that it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire 50% stake in General Aeronautics Private Limited. The Bengaluru-based company provides robotic drones and drone-based solutions for crop protection. The company didn't disclose the financial details of the deal. The deal is expected to close by July 31, 2022.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Will give away most of my wealth; kids to get the family house: Moderna CEO
text: Moderna CEO Stéphane Bancel told Bloomberg in an interview that he plans to donate the bulk of his family wealth. The 49-year-old billionaire said, "[My kids] will get the family house, you know. But the rest we're going to give away." Bancel holds a 1.36% stake in Moderna and has an estimated net worth of $4.1 billion, as per Bloomberg.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 'Fun and Tasty', 'The Same One' among possible new names for McDonald's in Russia
text: McDonald's in Russia has registered possible new brand names such as ‘Fun and Tasty’, 'The Same One', 'Just Like That' and ‘Open Checkout’ for the firm taking over its restaurants in the country. McDonald's, which owns 84% of its restaurants in Russia, is selling its nearly 850 stores in the country to a local licensee, Alexander Govor.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Drone industry to reach ₹15,000 cr turnover by 2026: Scindia
text: Addressing the 'Bharat Drone Mahotsav 2022' event, Union Minister for Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia said, "It is estimated that the drone industry will reach ₹15,000 crore turnover by the year 2026." Currently, there are 270 drone startups in India, Scindia said during the event. 'Bharat Drone Mahotsav 2022' is a two-day event (May 27-28) being held in Delhi's Pragati Maidan.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Broadcom to acquire VMware for $61 billion in one of the largest tech deals
text: Broadcom Inc. agreed to buy cloud-computing company VMware Inc. for about $61 billion in cash and stock in one of the largest technology deals of all time. VMware shareholders will elect to receive either $142.50 in cash or 0.2520 shares of Broadcom common stock for each VMware share. Broadcom will also assume $8 billion of VMware's net debt.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: India's interests no different from EU's: India on importing Russian oil in ruble
text: On being asked whether India would pay in ruble for Russian oil at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said every country has to look after its national interest. He added that India's interests are no different from the European Union's. He said any suggestion that India was contributing to the Ukraine situation doesn't stand scrutiny.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: I'm a fan of Jack, wish he stayed on the board: Musk after Dorsey exits Twitter board
text: After former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey stepped down from the company's board, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "I'm a fan of Jack." Musk added, "Wish he would stay on the board, but I understand that he needs to move on." Dorsey had quit as Twitter CEO in November last year after handing over the post to Indian-origin Parag Agrawal.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Tesla planning to build 24-hr diner & a drive-in theatre in LA: Report
text: Tesla is reportedly planning to build a 24-hour diner with a drive-in movie theatre and a supercharger station in Los Angeles. As per a report, on May 19, Tesla filed the necessary documents for this. The site will have 28 supercharger stalls and two movie screens that can accommodate over 200 people while food will reportedly be delivered to cars.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: 25-yr-old college dropout named youngest self-made billionaire by Forbes
text: Alexandr Wang, 25, has been named the world's youngest self-made billionaire by Forbes. Wang dropped out of MIT at the age of 19 to co-found a software company, Scale AI. His company helps in deploying artificial intelligence and generates an estimated $100 million in revenue at $7.3 billion valuation. Wang's estimated 15% stake in the company is worth $1 billion.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Ex-Twitter official accuses Dorsey of 'backstabbing' Twitter board by helping Musk
text: An ex-Twitter board member has accused former CEO Jack Dorsey of "backstabbing" his company’s board by helping Tesla CEO Elon Musk acquire it. Jason Goldman said that after it was agreed to bring Musk on as a director, Dorsey "shared his personal view that Twitter would be able to better focus on execution as a private company".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter investors sue Musk for 'manipulating' firm's stock price via his tweets
text: Twitter investors have sued Tesla CEO Elon Musk, accusing him of "market manipulation" and for a decline in Twitter's stock price. They claimed Musk saved himself $156 million by not revealing that he had purchased more than 5% of Twitter by March 14. Musk's criticism of Twitter via his tweets also led to the company's share price drop, they added.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Alibaba reports slowest revenue growth since 2014 amid COVID-19 outbreaks
text: Alibaba Group on Thursday reported a 9% increase in its fourth-quarter revenue, its slowest quarterly revenue growth since it went public in 2014. The company said that its core e-commerce platforms suffered due to COVID-19 outbreaks and subsequent restrictions. Notably, the company witnessed a 64% increase in revenue growth during the same quarter last year.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Lido Learning's 1,200 workers who were told to resign yet to receive Jan salary: Report
text: Edtech startup Lido Learning is yet to pay salaries for January to over 1,200 employees who were asked to resign abruptly in February first week, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. Earlier this month, employees received 'full and final settlement' letter from Lido Learning, however, they haven't received anything yet. The employees were asked to resign over video call, citing funding crunch.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: No such decisions made: EY CEO on reports of audit, advisory business split
text: Amid reports of Ernst & Young considering a worldwide split of its audit and advisory businesses, CEO Carmine Di Sibio has said that "no such decisions have been made." In an internal memo to the firm's partners, the CEO said, "With the changing competitive, regulatory and market landscape, work is ongoing to evaluate strategic alternatives."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Who were the highest paid female CEOs in the US in 2021?
text: Advanced Micro Devices' CEO Lisa T Su was the highest-paid female executive at $29.5 million in the US in 2021. She was followed by General Motors' CEO Mary T Barra at $29.1 million, General Dynamics' Phebe N Novakovic at $23.6 million, Nasdaq's Adena Friedman at $20 million and Northrop Grumman's Kathy J Warden at $19.5 million.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh gets 88% pay hike, salary jumps to ₹79.75 crore per annum
text: Software major Infosys CEO Salil Parekh’s salary has been revised upwards by 88% to ₹79.75 crore per annum. The salary announcement comes days after Infosys reappointed Salil Parekh as MD and CEO for five more years. The company said it considered factors such as total shareholder return, rise in market cap and growth while recommending change in remuneration.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who were the highest paid male CEOs in the US in 2021?
text: As per the data compiled by Associated Press and Equilar, Expedia CEO Peter Kern was the highest-paid male executive at $296.2 million in the US in 2021. He was followed by Warner Bros. Discovery CEO David Zaslav at $246.6 million, ServiceNow’s William McDermott at $165.8 million, Apple's Tim Cook at $98.7 million and JPMorgan Chase’s Jamie Dimon at $84.4 million.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Who do you trust less, politicians or billionaires: Musk asks in poll
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to take a poll on who the users "trust less", politicians or billionaires. Following his poll, Musk extended a challenge to US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, saying, "I dare you to run the same poll with your followers." Replying to his tweet, a user wrote, "I trust AOC more than I trust you, Elon."
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Car tech firm ECARX to go public in China's largest US listing since DiDi
text: Chinese auto tech startup ECARX, backed by billionaire Li Shufu, on Thursday said it will go public through a merger with blank-check company COVA Acquisition Corp in a deal that values it at $3.82 billion. As per Bloomberg, this will be the largest Chinese listing in the US since DiDi Global Inc. ECARX develops software and hardware systems for cars.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: B'luru to get IKEA store in June, K'taka CM invited for inauguration
text: Swedish furniture retailer IKEA will inaugurate its first store in Bengaluru in June with an investment of ₹1,000 crore. The store will be inaugurated in Bengaluru's Nagasandra area by the Ingka Group's CEO, Jesper Brodin, who has also invited Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai for the event. The Bengaluru store would be IKEA's third store in India after Mumbai and Hyderabad.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: 7 yrs worth of foreign portfolio investments wiped out in 8 months
text: Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) have net sold Indian stocks worth ₹2.5 lakh crore since October 2021, as per data available on National Securities Depository Limited (NSDL). This is more than the net investment of ₹2.2 lakh crore made by FPIs between 2014 and 2020, data showed. Meanwhile, domestic retail investors net invested ₹2.1 lakh crore in 2021 and 2022.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: India has never been a large importer of Russian oil: Piyush Goyal
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal, while speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos, said that India has never been a very large importer of petroleum products from Russia. "India always looked at diversified sources for our petroleum requirements," Goyal stated. He added that any suggestion that India is increasing imports from Russia doesn't stand scrutiny.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Interest rate hikes likely to not cause prolonged stress: Axis Bank CEO
text: Some stress will be built in the system due to interest rate hikes, but it will likely not be prolonged, said Axis Bank MD and CEO Amitabh Chaudhry. "When you look at larger banks and large institutions, people have beefed up their balance sheet in a very significant manner," Chaudhry said. "I'm not anticipating any large NPA problems," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India will get criticised for choosing self-reliance, so be it: Adani
text: India's richest person Gautam Adani, in a post he shared on LinkedIn, said India is right to focus on self-reliance and must go through the process even if there is pushback. "Many will try to stop us from building semiconductor plants...from investing a larger portion of our GDP in defence...So be it," he wrote, while calling global cooperation a "facade".
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Shell in talks with Indian consortium to sell Russian LNG plant stake: Report
text: Shell is in talks with a consortium of Indian energy companies, including ONGC Videsh and GAIL, to sell its 27.5% stake in Russia's Sakhalin-2 LNG plant, Reuters reported. Shell had said in February that it'd shut down all its operations in Russia. It's also asking the Indian consortium for separate bids for long-term LNG supply deals it has with Sakhalin-2.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Axis Mutual Fund ropes in Deloitte to probe front-running scam: Report
text: Axis Mutual Fund (MF) has roped in Deloitte as a second investigator to probe the front-running scam at the firm, Times Now reported citing The Economic Times. Alvarez and Marsal is already involved in the investigation. This comes after market regulator SEBI had reportedly asked Axis MF to pin down the precise modus operandi in the case.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India not planning to curb rice exports, has sufficient stocks: Report
text: India, the world's top rice exporter, is reportedly not planning to curb exports of rice as it has sufficient stocks and local rates are lower than state-set support prices. "There's no concern at all in terms of either prices...or availability for exports and domestic requirements," a government official told Reuters. This comes after India banned wheat exports on May 14.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: CBI arrests businessman Avinash Bhosale in Yes Bank-DHFL case
text: The CBI on Thursday arrested Pune-based real estate group ABIL's Chairman Avinash Bhosale in the Yes Bank-Dewan Housing Finance Corporation (DHFL) fraud case. The arrest comes nearly a month after CBI conducted raids on the premises of Bhosale and two other builders Vinod Goenka and Shahid Balwa. As per CBI, illicit funds were allegedly routed through several real estate companies.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Vedanta to finalise location of $20 bn semiconductor plant by June
text: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal told Reuters that the company will finalise a location for its $20 billion semiconductor and display plants in India by mid-June. "You have to create another Taiwan in India," Agarwal said, adding that Vedanta's first chip product will be ready in two years. Taiwan's Foxconn will have technical responsibility for the operation, he added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Moody's cuts India's 2022 GDP forecast from 9.1% to 8.8%
text: Ratings agency Moody's Investors Service on Thursday lowered its GDP growth forecast for India for 2022 by 30 basis points from 9.1% to 8.8%. "Rise in crude oil, food and fertiliser prices will weigh on household finances and spending in the months ahead," Moody's noted in its report. It also slashed its forecast for advanced economies from 3.2% to 2.6%.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: ONGC to sell stake, seeks global help to develop fields
text: Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) is offering a stake to global oil companies to enlist their help in developing challenging fields in India, according to a tender document. ONGC didn't disclose the size of the stake it's selling. It aims to develop the Deen Dayal West field in Bay of Bengal and the ultra-deep discoveries in Krishna Godavari Basin.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Beg India to reconsider wheat export ban: IMF chief Kristalina
text: Talking about India's wheat export ban, International Monetary Fund (IMF) chief Kristalina Georgieva said, "I do have an appreciation for the fact that India needs to feed nearly 1.35 billion people...but I would beg India to reconsider as soon as possible." "The more countries step into export restrictions, the more others would be tempted to do so," she told NDTV.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Satish Kaushik accuses Go First of using 'dubious ways to earn money', says got no refund
text: Satish Kaushik accused Go First airline of using "dubious ways" to earn money. Kaushik said his office booked two seats "in first row with middle seat" and paid ₹25,000. He alleged the flight sold middle seat to another passenger despite his office paying for it. Kaushik added his office has been contacting customer care and their reply was 'no refund'.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Stuck for 3 hrs, no breakfast: SpiceJet flyer as he shares video amid ransomware attack
text: After SpiceJet said flights are operating normally following an attempted ransomware attack, a passenger refuted its claim. "We're stuck...since 3 hrs and 45 mins? Neither cancelling nor operating, sitting in the flight...No breakfast, no response!" the Twitter user wrote while sharing a video. "Who says the flights have normalised...People waiting from 6 am," another tweet read.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Coinbase becomes first crypto company to get listed on Fortune 500
text: Coinbase, the San Francisco-based crypto exchange, has become the first cryptocurrency company to break into the Fortune 500 list. Currently ranked at 437, Coinbase has a market value of $41,670 million and over 3,700 employees, as per Fortune. The exchange was singled out by Fortune editor-in-chief Alyson Shontell as one of "several pandemic winners".
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Elon Musk's net worth drops below $200 billion again as Tesla share price tumbles
text: Elon Musk has again fallen out of the $200 billion club, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Musk, the world's richest person, saw his fortune drop by 5.4% to $192.7 billion on Tuesday as shares of Tesla Inc slid almost 7%. Musk last dipped below the $200 billion threshold in March.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Spicejet systems face attempted ransomware attack; flight departures affected
text: Spicejet on Wednesday tweeted, "Certain SpiceJet systems faced an attempted ransomware attack last night that impacted and slowed down morning flight departures today." "Our IT team has contained and rectified the situation and flights are operating normally now," the airline said. Several passengers tweeted they were stuck and there was no communication from the airline.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Musk pledges $6.25 billion more in equity to fund Twitter deal
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has pledged an additional $6.25 billion in equity financing to fund the $44-billion offer for Twitter. He is also in talks with Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey and others to help finance the deal. Shares of Twitter rose more than 5% hours after the news of Musk's commitment broke, while Tesla shares dipped about 1%.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: India imposes restrictions on sugar exports for first time in 6 years
text: Centre has imposed restrictions on sugar exports for the first time in six years from June 1. "To maintain domestic availability and price stability of sugar in the country during sugar season 2021-22 (October-September), central government to regulate sugar exports wef June 1, till further orders. Government will allow sugar exports up to 100 LMT," Ministry of Consumer Affairs said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: India has no plans to lift ban on wheat exports for now: Govt
text: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has said that India has no immediate plans to lift a ban on wheat exports. "Currently there is instability in the world, if we were to do that (lift the ban), it would only help black marketeers, hoarders and speculators," Goyal told Reuters. India banned wheat export on May 14.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Which are the top 10 companies in America as per Fortune 500 list?
text: Walmart has topped the 68th edition of the Fortune 500 ranking of America's largest companies, with $572 billion revenue. It is followed by Amazon and Apple, with $469 billion and $365 billion revenue respectively. The list also features CVS Health, UnitedHealth Group and Exxon Mobil. Berkshire Hathaway, Alphabet, McKesson and AmerisourceBergen are the other companies in the top 10.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: British retailer Marks & Spencer to exit Russia after 17 years
text: British clothing-to-food retailer Marks and Spencer on Wednesday announced that it will fully exit the Russian market after 17 years. It stopped shipments to Russia in March but earlier stated that complex franchise deals prevented it from withdrawing completely. The company, which has 48 stores there, will face a $39 million hit from its exit, it said.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: D*** move: Musk on Gates allegedly funding organisations against him
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in response to an article saying billionaire Bill Gates' foundation funded anti-Musk organisations, said, "What a d*** move!" The article claimed that 11 anti-Musk organisations have received funding from a Gates-backed entity. Earlier this month, Gates had said Musk could make Twitter "worse" but added that people should have an open mind and "never underestimate Elon".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Andhra signs deals worth $16 bn at WEF, to generate 38,000 jobs
text: Andhra Pradesh signed renewables investment pacts worth $16 billion (around ₹1.2 lakh crore) with  three companies, Adani Green Energy, Singapore's GIC sovereign wealth fund-backed Greenko and Aurobindo Realty & Infrastructure, during the WEF at Davos. The pacts involve setting up  hydro, solar and wind power related projects in the state. The investments will create 38,000 jobs, an official said.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Tesla loses bid to move sexual harassment suit to arbitration in US
text: A US judge has rejected Tesla's bid to send a lawsuit alleging widespread sexual harassment at the company's California plant to private arbitration. As per plaintiff Jessica Barraza, workers and supervisors at the plant routinely made lewd comments and gestures to female employees and Tesla failed to address complaints. At least six similar cases are pending in California state court.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Amazon opens first physical fashion retail store in Los Angeles
text: Amazon on Wednesday announced that it has opened its first brick-and-mortar clothing retail store, called Amazon Style, in US' Los Angeles. As per Amazon, the store will use machine-learning technology to help customers find clothes and personalise recommendations. Customers shopping on the Amazon app will also have the option to try out their selections at the physical store, it added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Pay more attention: Ethereum Co-founder on recent crypto crash
text: People must pay more attention to what is belying the currency name when they get involved, said Ethereum's Co-founder Gavin Wood with regard to the recent crypto crash which wiped $800 billion off their value. The crypto crash led to Terra's LUNA crypto token crashing nearly 100%. "The internet has no real concept of legality," Wood added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Gujarat govt to soon launch India's first carbon trading market
text: Gujarat government has announced plans for setting up India's first cap-and-trade market for carbon emissions. The market will help industries that are unable to meet their emission targets to trade and purchase surplus targets from other industries which have met their goals. Gujarat government has also been running the world's first Emissions Trading Market for Particulate Pollution since 2019.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Power Ministry seeks 2-yr extension to emissions deadline: Report
text: The Power Ministry has sought a two-year extension for the installation of emission-cutting equipment in thermal power plants, Reuters reported. The government initially had set a 2017 deadline but later changed it to varying deadlines for different regions, ending in 2022. Thermal power companies account for some 80% of India's industrial emissions of sulphur- and nitrous-oxides, Reuters said.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Govt on course to privatise two public sector banks: Report
text: The government is committed to the privatisation of two public sector banks (PSBs) and will take the steps required in the coming months, PTI reported. As per its sources, Central Bank of India and Indian Overseas Bank are the likely candidates for privatisation. The government had announced its intent to take up the privatisation of two PSBs in Budget 2021-22.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Would've been nice, but $10 bn was too much: KM Birla on Holcim deal
text: Aditya Birla Group Chairperson Kumar Mangalam Birla on Wednesday said his company couldn't acquire Holcim's Indian business "primarily due to pricing issue". He stated, "It'd have been nice to have clinched the Holcim deal...[But] $10 billion was too high a price." Holcim's stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC was eventually taken over by Adani Group in a $10.5 billion deal.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Can alter output target: Tata Steel CEO on 15% export tax on steel
text: Tata Steel CEO TV Narendran told Reuters that if the 15% export tax on some steel products remains in place for a long time, the company might have to review its production targets. "You will only build as much capacity as you need for the domestic market," Narendran stated. He added that in the medium-to-long term, India should "encourage" exports.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Cabinet approves sale of govt's stake in Hindustan Zinc: Report
text: The Union Cabinet has approved sale of the Centre's entire residual stake in Hindustan Zinc Limited, Moneycontrol reported citing CNBC Awaaz. The government owns a 29.5% stake in the mining company, while Vedanta Limited holds a 64.92% stake. At current market price, the government's residual stake in Hindustan Zinc is valued at around ₹38,740 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Advanced economies to be back on track by 2024: IMF's Gopinath
text: International Monetary Fund's First Deputy MD Gita Gopinath on Wednesday said advanced economies will be back on track by 2024, but developing economies would be 5% below where they would've been otherwise. "Prices of commodities including fuel and food are going up around the world," Gopinath said. Central banks are trying to tackle this high level of inflation, she added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Shell causing 'extreme harm' to planet: UK consultant as she quits
text: Caroline Dennett, a UK-based safety consultant for Shell for 11 years, quit publicly while accusing the company of causing "extreme harm" to the planet. "I can no longer work for a company that ignores all...the risks of climate change," Dennett wrote on LinkedIn. She added, "Contrary to Shell's public expressions around net zero, they're...planning to explore and extract much more."
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Indigo's net loss widens to ₹1,681.8 crore in Q4, income rises 29%
text: India's biggest airline Indigo on Wednesday reported a net loss of ₹1,681.8 crore in the quarter ending March 31, 2022. This year's Q4 loss was 46.6% more than the loss incurred by the airline in the corresponding period a year ago. Meanwhile, its total income for the quarter jumped 29% y-o-y to ₹8,207.5 crore from ₹6,361.8 crore in Q4 FY21.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: 5 NBFCs' registration cancelled due to irregular lending practices
text: RBI on Wednesday said it has cancelled the Certificate of Registration (CoR) of five non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) due to irregular lending practices. The CoRs were cancelled as the NBFCs violated RBI's Fair Practices Code. The NBFCs were also not complying with extant regulations pertaining to charging of excessive interest and had resorted to undue harassment of customers, RBI said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Snap's shares crash 41% in their biggest-ever intraday decline
text: Shares of Snapchat's parent company Snap crashed over 41% on Tuesday, marking their biggest intraday decline ever since the company went public in 2017. The company's share price dipped below its initial public offering (IPO) price to as low as $13.55. Snap's stock crashed after the company cut its revenue and profit forecasts citing rising inflation and Russia-Ukraine war's impact.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt allows duty free import of crude soyabean, sunflower oils for 2 years
text: The Central government has allowed duty free import of crude soyabean oil and crude sunflower oil for a period of two years. A quantity of 20 lakh metric tonne of crude soyabean oil and crude sunflower oil each per year will incur a 'NIL' rate of customs duty and agricultural infrastructure and development cess, effective May 25, the government said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Mahindra honoured at US college where his father was the 1st Indian graduate
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra was honoured with the Dean's Medal at Tufts University's The Fletcher School, 75 years after his father Harish Mahindra became the first-ever Indian graduate of the college. Sharing pictures from the ceremony, Mahindra said, "In the 75th year of Indian Independence, I was honoured to be the first Indian to address the School's Class Day."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 2 IIMs make it to world's top 50 colleges for executive education in FT ranking
text: Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Ahmedabad and IIM Bangalore have made it among the top 50 colleges for executive education, occupying the 39th and 45th places in Financial Times (FT) latest ranking. The executive education custom FT ranking also featured the Indian School of Business, Hyderabad (38th rank), apart from IIM Ahmedabad (50) and IIM Bangalore (43).
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Snap to slow down hiring, expects to miss quarterly revenue target
text: Snap CEO Evan Spiegel has told his employees that the company would significantly slow down hiring for the rest of the year and it may miss its revenue goals for the quarter. Spiegel wrote, "Like many companies, we continue to face rising inflation and interest rates, supply chain shortages and labour disruptions,...the impact of the war in Ukraine, and more."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: The richer someone is, the fewer kids they have, I'm an exception: Musk
text: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted, "Contrary to what many think, the richer someone is, the fewer kids they have." The 50-year-old father of seven children said he's "a rare exception", adding that "most people I know have zero or one kid". Musk earlier said that the belief that having fewer children is better for the environment is "total nonsense".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Russia's biggest mobile operator starts selling used phones amid inflation
text: Russia’s biggest mobile operator MTS has started selling discounted and used smartphones amid inflation and Western brands suspending shipments. While Apple has paused all product sales in Russia due to the Ukraine war, sales of Chinese smartphone brands doubled in the first two weeks of March in Russia. "This is a good opportunity for our company," said an MTS official.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: $200 billion wiped off social media firms' market value after Snap's profit warning
text: Social media companies lost about $200 billion in market value on Tuesday after Snap's shares crashed over 40%. The sector-wide selloff was triggered after Snapchat's parent company said it is expecting to miss quarterly revenue and profit targets and will have to slow hiring. Shares of Meta Platforms, Pinterest, Twitter and Google-parent Alphabet were all down between 7% and 24%.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Delhivery shares close 10% higher on first day of trading, m-cap hits ₹38,851 cr
text: Shares of logistics startup Delhivery closed 10.11% higher on their first day of trading on Tuesday. The stock ended at ₹536.25 on the NSE, after listing at a premium of 1.7% over an issue price of ₹487 per share. The Gurugram-based startup, which had raised ₹5,235 crore through its IPO, held a market capitalisation of ₹38,851 crore on Tuesday's close.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Klarna doesn't exist in a bubble: CEO after firing 10% of startup's workforce
text: Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski told employees the Swedish fintech startup "doesn't exist in a bubble" as he announced plans to fire about 10% of its global workforce. "When we set our business plans for 2022...it was a very different world," he wrote. "Since then, we've seen a tragic...war in Ukraine unfold...increase in inflation, a highly volatile stock market," Siemiatkowski added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Delhivery rises 10% after its shares list at 1.68% premium
text: Logistics and supply chain startup Delhivery's shares saw a nearly 10% rise in intraday trade on Tuesday after its stock got listed at ₹495.20 apiece, 1.68% over the issue price, on NSE. On BSE, the shares were listed at ₹493 apiece, a premium of 1.2% over its issue price of ₹487. Delhivery had launched its ₹5,235-crore IPO on May 11.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Zomato shares record best day since market debut, close 14% higher
text: Shares of homegrown food delivery startup Zomato on Tuesday recorded their best day since the stock market debut in July last year. Zomato shares closed 14.72% higher on NSE on Tuesday after soaring 18% during intraday trading. The company's shares gained despite Zomato reporting a net loss of ₹359.7 crore for the fourth quarter, while its revenue surged 75% year-on-year.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India considers tax cut on soybean and sunflower oils: Report
text: India is considering cutting an import levy on soybean and sunflower oils amid surging prices of food, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday. The government is weighing whether to reduce the agriculture infrastructure and development cess, currently at 5%, or abolish it, the report said. A decision on the matter could be taken this week, Bloomberg quoted a source as saying.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India looking to limit sugar exports, say reports; sugar companies' shares plunge
text: Shares of sugar companies plunged on Tuesday after reports said that Indian government is looking to limit sugar exports for the first time in six years to prevent a surge in domestic prices. Reuters reported the government could cap this season's exports at 10 million tonnes. India is the world's biggest sugar producer and the second biggest exporter behind Brazil.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sri Lanka seeks $500 million loan from India for purchase of petroleum products
text: Sri Lanka is seeking a $500-million loan from the Export-Import Bank of India (India Exim Bank) to purchase petroleum products amid severe economic crisis. Sri Lanka on Tuesday raised petrol and diesel prices by record 24.3% and 38.4%, respectively. On Monday, India delivered around 40,000 metric tonnes of petrol to Sri Lanka, days after supplying 40,000 metric tonnes of diesel.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna gets ₹3.12 crore demand notice from SEBI
text: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has issued a notice to NSE's former CEO Chitra Ramkrishna asking her to pay ₹3.12 crore in a case related to governance lapses at the stock exchange. The SEBI has warned Ramkrishna of arrest and attachment of assets and bank accounts if she fails to pay the penalty amount within 15 days.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Adani Green to invest ₹60,000 crore in Andhra, create 10,000 jobs
text: Adani Green Energy has signed an MoU with Andhra Pradesh government to set up projects worth around ₹60,000 crore in the state. The renewable energy company will set up a 3,700 MW pumped storage hydro power plant and a 10,000 MW solar power project. The projects are expected to create direct and indirect employment for 10,000 people.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Egyptian media tycoon jailed for sexually assaulting 7 orphan girls
text: An Egyptian court has sentenced businessman Mohamed el-Amin to three years in prison for sexually assaulting seven minor girls in an orphanage he founded. He has also been ordered to pay a fine of 200,000 Egyptian pounds (about $11,000). The tycoon, who founded several Egyptian media outlets, was arrested in January after allegations of sexual abuse at the orphanage surfaced.
author: Athira Sasidharan

headlines: Idea that sustainable business is costly needs to go: Unilever CEO
text: Unilever CEO Alan Jope said the idea that sustainable business is costly needs to go. Speaking at a panel discussion at the World Economic Forum 2022 in Davos, Jope said, "Our sustainable brands...are growing much faster than the rest of our portfolio." Unilever's customers, particularly young people, are making brand choices based on social and environmental impact, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: US oil price drops below $110 mark on global recession fears
text: US oil price fell below the $110 mark on Tuesday amid fears of a possible global recession and China's COVID-19 curbs affecting supply. While US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell 72 cents to $109.57/barrel, Brent crude fell 56 cents to $112.86/barrel. Price of Brent crude earlier hit $139/barrel in March this year, its highest since 2008.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Export duty hike on iron ore to ensure steel supply for domestic use: Govt
text: Steel Secretary Sanjay Singh on Tuesday defended the government's move to increase export duty by 50% on iron ore and 15% on some steel intermediaries. Singh said the decision was taken to ensure that "domestically we can consume more than we produce". He added that the raw material problem was addressed by waiving import duty on coking coal and ferronickel.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Aditya Birla Fashion to sell 7.5% stake to GIC to raise ₹2,195 cr
text: Aditya Birla Fashion on Tuesday said its board has approved raising up to ₹2,195 crore by selling a minority stake of 7.5% to Singapore's GIC sovereign wealth fund. Investments will be raised by way of preferential issuance of equity and warrants to an affiliate of GIC. After the transaction, Aditya Birla Group will hold 51.9% stake in the company.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: SC stays NGT order imposing over ₹15 cr fine on Coca-Cola bottler
text: The Supreme Court has stayed a National Green Tribunal order imposing a penalty of over ₹15 crore on Coca-Cola bottling unit Moon Beverages. Earlier this year, the NGT had found Moon Beverages guilty of exploiting groundwater for bottling plants in UP's Greater Noida and Sahibabad. As per the petitioner, the extraction was being done in an indiscreet and arbitrary manner.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: World lost 11.2 crore jobs in first quarter of 2022: ILO report
text: The number of hours worked globally in the first quarter of 2022 dropped to 3.8% below the employment situation before the pandemic, a report by International Labour Organisation (ILO) revealed. The report said this is equivalent to a deficit of 11.2 crore full-time jobs. It cited fresh lockdowns in China, Ukraine-Russia conflict and inflation as the reasons for the findings.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Housing prices rise by up to 11% across 8 cities in Jan-Mar: Report
text: A joint report by CREDAI, Colliers and Liases Foras said housing prices rose by up to 11% YoY across eight major cities between January and March 2022. Housing prices in Delhi-NCR witnessed the highest rise of 11% to ₹7,363/square feet, followed by Hyderabad with a 9% rise to ₹9,232/square feet. Ahmedabad saw an 8% rise to ₹5,721/square feet.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Virtue of subsidy only if it's swift & for short run: Piyush Goyal
text: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal, during a panel at the World Economic Forum in Davos, said the "virtue of subsidy is only when it's swift and in the short run". "Our approach isn't going to be driven by subsidies...It's going to be...focused on structural reform and ease of doing business," he stated while urging Indian businesses to be "more proactive".
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: SAIL posts its highest-ever revenue of ₹1.03 lakh crore in FY22
text: Steel Authority of India Ltd (SAIL) posted its all-time high revenue from operations of ₹1.03 lakh crore in the fiscal year ending March 31, 2022, the company said in a statement. It added that during FY22, SAIL clocked in its best-ever performance in production and sales. The company's profit after tax stood at ₹12,015 crore during the fiscal, it added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Starbucks to exit Russia after 15 years, workers to get 6-month salaries
text: Starbucks on Monday announced that it will exit the Russian market after nearly 15 years. The company, which has 130 licensed stores in Russia, had earlier suspended all business activity in the country following the invasion of Ukraine. Starbucks has said that it will continue to support the 2,000 workers it employs in Russia, including paying them for six months.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt issues warning for restaurants, says 'can't force customers to pay 'service charge''
text: The Department of Consumer Affairs on Monday cautioned restaurants that are forcefully making customers pay 'service charges', the government said. It stated that service charge is voluntary and at the discretion of consumers. This comes after a Hyderabad restaurant was fined for forcing a customer to pay service charge.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Gautam Adani among 3 Indians on TIME's 100 Most Influential People of 2022 list
text: India's richest person Gautam Adani, SC advocate Karuna Nundy and Kashmiri human rights activist Khurram Parvez have been featured in TIME magazine's world's 100 most influential people of 2022 list. Adani has featured in 'Titans' section alongside Apple CEO Tim Cook. Nundy and Parvez have featured in 'Leaders' section with Russian and Ukrainian Presidents Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskyy.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Bitcoin recovers to $30,000 after longest run of weekly losses since 2011
text: Bitcoin on Monday recovered to trade above $30,000 after the recent collapse of algorithmic stablecoin TerraUSD triggered a massive selloff in cryptocurrencies. The gain comes after Bitcoin fell for seven straight weeks, marking the longest losing streak for the world's largest cryptocurrency since August 2011, as per Bloomberg. Bitcoin rose 1.7% to trade at around $30,425 in London on Monday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk lost $10 bn net worth in a single day after sexual harassment claims emerged
text: Elon Musk lost $10 billion of his net worth in a single day after sexual harassment allegations against him were reported. Musk's wealth was about $212 billion on Thursday as per the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, it fell to $201 billion after the report emerged. Currently, at $204 billion on the index, he is still the richest person in the world.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: We've been cautioning, look what happened: RBI Governor on crypto crash
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das told CNBC-TV18, "We've been cautioning on crypto and look at what has happened to the crypto market now." Talking about the recent crash in crypto market, he added, "Had we been regulating it...people would be raising questions, 'what happened to regulations?'." He further said crypto will "seriously undermine" India's monetary, financial and macroeconomic stability.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Zomato shares surge 18% despite ₹360-crore loss in Q4 earnings
text: Zomato shares surged by 18% during intraday trade on Tuesday, a day after the company announced its March quarter earnings. The firm reported a loss of around ₹360 crore in the fourth quarter, nearly triple from its net loss of ₹134 crore in the year-ago period. At ₹1,211.8 crore, its revenue surged by 75% as against ₹692.4 crore in Q4FY21.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I don't use flight attendants: Musk amid claims of sexually harassing an air hostess
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk while replying to a follower wrote, "Astute observers of my plane...will note...I don't use a flight attendant." Musk has been accused of sexually harassing a SpaceX employed flight attendant in 2016. The follower had shared a statement by the SpaceX President, to which Musk also said, "Only fruit and nuts are stocked on the plane."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Zomato's net loss nearly triples to ₹359.7 crore in Q4, revenue rises 75%
text: Zomato on Monday reported a net loss of ₹359.7 crore for the fourth quarter ended March 31, 2022, marking a nearly threefold increase compared to ₹134.2 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. The food delivery company's revenue from operations stood at ₹1,211.8 crore, up 75.01% from ₹692.4 crore in the year-ago period.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: False allegations: SpaceX President on sexual harassment claims against Musk
text: SpaceX President Gwynne Shotwell has defended CEO Elon Musk against the sexual harassment allegations reported against him recently. In an email to the staff, Shotwell wrote, "Personally, I believe the allegations to be false; not because I work for Elon, but because I've worked closely with him for 20 years and have never seen nor heard anything resembling these allegations."
author: Ridham Gambhir
