headlines: Heatwaves credit negative for India, could worsen inflation, hurt growth: Moody's
text: The prolonged high temperatures that are affecting much of the northwestern part of India are a credit negative for the country, Moody's Investors Service said in a report. The report stated that heatwaves will curb wheat production and could lead to extended power outages. Therefore, heatwaves could exacerbate already high inflation and hurt growth in India, Moody's analysts further said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Serum Institute planning to set up its 1st manufacturing plant in Africa
text: The Serum Institute of India is planning to set up its first manufacturing plant in Africa in its efforts to expand globally. CEO Adar Poonawalla said he was meeting African officials in Davos for the same and also said that such projects usually require an investment of around $300 million. He didn't mention what products the African plant might make.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Airbnb to close its business in China amid tight COVID-19 restrictions
text: Airbnb is shutting down its domestic business in China amid the country's tight COVID-19 restrictions. All listings for homes in the country will be removed from July 30. While Airbnb set up its business in China in 2016, stays in the country accounted for only 1% of the company's revenue over the last few years.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Vacate govt-owned housing colonies by July 26: Air India tells staff
text: Air India has asked its employees to vacate the government-owned housing colonies by July 26, according to an official document. While Tata Group won the bid for Air India last year, as per terms of disinvestment, the airline's non-core assets such as housing colonies will remain with the government. Air India has two major housing colonies in Delhi and Mumbai.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: 5G mass adoption won't happen overnight: Vodafone Idea CEO
text: Mass adoption of 5G won't happen overnight as it lacks scalable use cases, Vodafone Idea CEO Ravinder Takkar told Financial Express. "5G can be an enabler to digital services but can that service be available tomorrow or day after...I don't think that's the case," Takkar said. He added that the upcoming 5G auctions will be different from the past auctions.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Tesla still believes in ESG: Investor after Musk calls it 'scam'
text: Tesla investor John Streur has said the automaker still believes in ESG indexes after it was cut from S&P 500 ESG Index last week. Streur's comment comes after Tesla CEO Elon Musk criticised S&P Global Ratings and called ESG a "scam". Asked if Musk believes in ESG, Streur said, "I can't speak for him, but I think his company does."
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Toyota to cut global production plan by 1,00,000 in June
text: Toyota Motor will cut its global production plan by about 1,00,000 to roughly 8,50,000 vehicles in June due to chip shortage. The firm said that chips shortage, COVID-19 outbreaks and other factors "are making it difficult to look ahead". However, it didn't change its estimate of producing about 9.7 million vehicles globally by March 2023.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Pepperfry to file prospectus for $250 million-IPO in June: Report
text: Pepperfry has kicked off plans to raise $250 million through an IPO in 2022, Moneycontrol reported. The IPO prospectus, which is being prepared currently, is likely to be filed with market regulator SEBI by June. Pepperfry aims to raise the funds through a combination of primary and secondary issuance of shares and the final IPO size may vary later.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India better positioned to handle volatility than other nations: Gopinath
text: The risk of global recession is lower than individual countries going into recessions, IMF's First Deputy MD Gita Gopinath said on Monday. "Inflation is a serious concern in many parts of the world," Gopinath stated. She noted that India is in a better position to handle volatility than other countries due to its $600 billion in reserves.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: RBI fines Bilaspur Nagrik Sahakari Bank ₹2.5 lakh for violating norms
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Monday imposed a monetary penalty of ₹2.5 lakh on Bilaspur Nagrik Sahakari Bank for violation of certain directives issued by it. As per RBI, the bank had not adhered to the prudential inter-bank (gross) exposure limit, among other violations. Last month, RBI fined Bank of Maharashtra ₹1.12 crore for non-compliance.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: ONGC becomes 1st E&P company to trade domestic gas on IGX
text: Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) on Monday announced it has become the first exploration and production (E&P) company to trade domestic gas on online delivery-based gas trading platform Indian Gas Exchange (IGX). ONGC said the gas traded was from ONGC Krishna Godavari 98/2 block. "The quantity sold by ONGC through the gas exchange will be enhanced slowly," it added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Marico acquires 54% stake in breakfast & snacks brand True Elements
text: The maker of brands like Saffola and Parachute, Marico, has acquired a 54% stake in True Elements through primary infusion and secondary buyouts, the company said. "True Elements is another step towards expanding our total addressable market in the healthy foods segment," said Marico MD and CEO Saugata Gupta. Several FMCG firms are acquiring digital-first food and beverage brands.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: DRDO probe finds serious battery defects in EVs that caught fire: Report
text: A Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) report has found serious defects in the batteries of electric vehicles (EVs) that were involved in the recent fire incidents, Free Press Journal reported. The defects reportedly occurred as EV manufacturers may have used "lower-grade materials to cut costs". The manufacturers have now been summoned by the government to submit an explanation.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's GDP growth may have declined to 3.5% in Q4: ICRA
text: India's GDP growth may have slowed down to 3.5% in Q4 FY22 from 5.4% in the previous quarter, rating agency ICRA said. The GVA seems to have risen even slower at 2.7% in Q4, compared to 4.7% in Q3, ICRA added. It cited impact of higher commodity prices on margins and decline in wheat yields, among others, as the reasons.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: RBI sets up panel to review customer service standards in banks
text: The RBI on Monday said it has set up a six-member committee to review customer service standards in banks, NBFCs and other entities regulated by it. The committee will evaluate the efficacy, adequacy and quality of customer service and also suggest measures. It will submit a report in three months from the date of its first meeting, the RBI added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Hope to start internet service on SpiceJet aircraft soon: CMD
text: SpiceJet is hoping to start a broadband internet service onboard its planes soon, the airline's Chairman and MD Ajay Singh wrote in his email to employees on SpiceJet's 17th anniversary. Singh added that the airline will induct more Boeing 737 Max aircraft over the next few months. He congratulated the company for being the country's "largest transporter of COVID-19 vaccines".
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Not expecting recession but it isn't out of question: IMF MD
text: International Monetary Fund's (IMF) Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva on Monday said she doesn't expect a recession for the world's major economies "at this point". However, she added, "It doesn't mean it's out of the question." The "horizon has darkened" since the IMF downgraded its 2022 growth outlook because of war in Ukraine, China's slowdown and global price shock, she added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: 13 countries to join new Asia-Pacific trade framework, announces Biden; India included
text: US President Joe Biden on Monday announced in Japan that 13 countries have joined a new, US-led Asia-Pacific trade initiative, the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity or the IPEF. Alongside the US, the other countries included in the framework are India, Australia, Brunei, Indonesia, Japan, the Republic of Korea, Malaysia, New Zealand, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Crypto has no underlying value, Govt more or less in sync with this: RBI Guv
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das while speaking about cryptocurrencies said it is "something whose underlying (value) is nothing". He said that statements coming from the Centre are "more or less in sync" with this. The Governor added, "There are big questions on how to regulate it. Our position remains...clear, it will...undermine the monetary, financial and macroeconomic stability of India."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Moderna, Pfizer making $1,000 profit every second from vaccine monopoly: Oxfam
text: Oxfam International in its latest research revealed that the COVID-19 pandemic created 40 new pharma billionaires and alleged that companies like Moderna and Pfizer are making $1,000 profit every second from their monopoly control of COVID-19 vaccines. It also said these companies are charging governments up to 24 times more than the potential cost of generic production.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: COVID-19 created a new billionaire every 30 hours: Oxfam at WEF in Davos
text: The COVID-19 pandemic created a new billionaire every 30 hours, said Oxfam International on Monday at the World Economic Forum in Davos. It said 573 people became new billionaires during the pandemic, at the rate of one every 30 hours. Oxfam noted that billionaires' wealth has risen more in the first 24 months of COVID-19 than in 23 years combined.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I have a secret Instagram account to check links friends send me: Musk
text: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk while replying to a follower, revealed that he has "a cheesy secret Instagram account" to click on links that friends send him. He was replying to a Twitter follower who said that many people thought Musk ran his Twitter account, to which Musk replied, "I don't have a burner Twitter account!"
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Even if we double the number of humans, environment is going to be fine: Musk
text: Elon Musk said the belief that having fewer children is better for the environment is "total nonsense", adding, "The environment's gonna be fine even if we doubled the [number] of humans." Musk warned against dropping birth rates, adding, "We don't want civilisation to end in adult diapers with a whimper." Humans need to at least "maintain our numbers", he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Musk's SpaceX looking to raise funds at a valuation of $127 billion: Report
text: Elon Musk's SpaceX is looking to raise up to $1.725 billion in new capital, CNBC reported citing a company-wide email. The spacecraft manufacturing company will raise new funds at a price of $70 per share, sending its valuation to $127 billion, CNBC added. With this, the 20-year-old company is poised to become the most valuable startup in the US.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air shares pics of its 1st aircraft, says 'Can't keep calm!'
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air on Monday tweeted pictures of its first aircraft. Sharing a picture of the aircraft, it wrote, "Can't keep calm! Say hi to our QP-pie!" While sharing another picture it wrote, "Coming soon to your sky". Akasa Air, which plans to start flight operations in July, had said that its airline code will be 'QP'.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: India's future is bright: SoftBank CEO Son after meeting PM Modi in Tokyo
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Japanese conglomerate SoftBank's billionaire Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son in Tokyo on Monday. "India is growing quickly. There are new startups and unicorns every day. I think India's future is bright," Son said. PM Modi commended SoftBank's role in India's startup sector and discussed opportunities in research, technology and ways to boost investment linkages.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: FRL independent directors facilitated fraudulent transfer of stores: Amazon
text: Amazon accused the independent directors of Future Retail (FRL) of facilitating "fraudulent" transfer of 835 stores to Reliance Group. It said the "narrative" of failure to pay "huge outstanding rent" to Reliance was a "sham" and that in January, FRL had said its outstanding rent was only ₹250 crore. The handover was a way to "alienate" retail stores, Amazon said.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: PM Modi meets leaders of 34 Japanese firms, proposes celebrating 'Japan Week'
text: PM Narendra Modi chaired a roundtable with the top executives and CEOs from 34 Japanese companies in Tokyo on Monday. PM Modi apprised the business leaders of the recent reforms undertaken by India and invited them to "Make in India for the World". He further proposed celebrating Japan's contribution to India's development journey in the form of a 'Japan Week'.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: World's 10 richest men own more wealth than bottom 40% of humanity: Oxfam
text: The world’s ten richest men own more wealth than the bottom 40% of humanity, 3.1 billion people, revealed Oxfam International in its latest research. According to Oxfam estimates, it would take 112 years for an average person in the bottom 50% to make equivalent to what a person in the top 1% makes in a year.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Group of millionaires protests, says 'tax us now' amid WEF at Davos
text: Amid the World Economic Forum (WEF), a group of millionaires protested in Davos and demanded that governments tax the wealthy to tackle the cost of living crises across the globe. "The only credible outcome from this conference (WEF) is to tax the richest and tax us now," said Phil White of 'Patriotic Millionaires'.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Oil prices at $110/barrel pose bigger threat than inflation: Hardeep Singh Puri
text: Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has said that oil prices staying at $110/barrel could pose bigger threats than inflation to the global economy. Speaking at Davos, the minister said, "If oil prices remain at $110/barrel you are not just talking about inflation, then you're talking about bigger threats. You know, that's where the R (recession) word comes in."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Auto stocks trade higher after Centre cuts excise duty on fuel; Maruti up by 4%
text: Shares of automobile companies traded higher during intraday trade on Monday after the central government announced a cut in excise duty on petrol and diesel. While the BSE Auto Index rose by 2.2%, shares of Ashok Leyland jumped by 5%, Maruti Suzuki India rose 4%, Mahindra and Mahindra climbed 3% and Tata Motors Ltd was up by 1.5%.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Govt warns SBI users of fake message claiming their account has been blocked
text: PIB's Fact Check Twitter account has warned SBI users against a fake message in circulation that tells customers that their account has been blocked. The fake message read, "Dear A/c holder your SBI Bank documents has expired A/c will be blocked. Now Click http://sbikvs.II Update by NetBanking." It also asked users to not respond to such messages and emails.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Expectation of a rate hike is a no-brainer: RBI Guv on upcoming repo rate hikes
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das in an interview revealed that the central bank wants to increase repo rates in the next few meetings and that the "expectation of a rate hike is a no-brainer". He said, "By how much, I won't be able to tell now but to say that (it will be hiked) to 5.15% now will not be accurate."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: HSBC suspends top executive over his comments on climate change: Report
text: HSBC has reportedly suspended a top executive after he criticised the finance industry for worrying too much about climate change. As per a report, the executive also said, "Climate change isn't a financial risk that we need to worry about…Who cares if Miami is six meters underwater in 100 years, Amsterdam's been six meters underwater for ages...We'll cope with it."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Will explore more EV partnerships: Mahindra CEO after VW deal
text: Mahindra and Mahindra will explore sourcing more components from other companies for faster growth of its EV portfolio, the company's CEO Anish Shah said. "It's better to source the best...rather than do everything ourselves," Shah added. Last week, Mahindra signed a partnership agreement with Volkswagen (VW) to explore equipping its electric cars with VW's motors and battery components.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Successful eradication of polio will be super joyful: Bill Gates
text: Microsoft's Co-founder Bill Gates said, "If we do succeed in polio eradication, that will be super joyful," on being asked about one thing he's bought that's brought him the most joy. "The thing that has succeeded the best so far...is funding vaccines for poor countries through GAVI," Gates added. He further said that he likes burgers and nice tennis racquets.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Paytm forms general insurance JV, to invest ₹950 cr in 10 years
text: Paytm parent One97 Communications said it has formed a joint venture general insurance company in which it plans to invest ₹950 crore in 10 years. Following the investment, Paytm will hold 74% stake in Paytm General Insurance, while CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma's VSS Holdings will have a 26% stake. Recently, Paytm's proposed acquisition of Raheja QBE General Insurance was terminated.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: 1 arrested in hit-and-run case which killed Zepto delivery boy in Delhi
text: Delhi Police on Monday arrested a man accused in a hit-and-run case in which a delivery executive working with Zepto was killed. Police believe the accused, Sudhakar Yadav, was driving a Tata Nexon in Dwarka on Thursday night when he hit the victim, Karan Raju, from behind. Raju succumbed to his injuries after being rushed to the hospital.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Jet Airways appoints 4 new senior execs after DGCA nod to fly again
text: Jet Airways, which was recently granted permit to fly again by DGCA, has announced the appointment of Mark Turner as Vice President (Inflight Product and Services). It has also hired Prabh Sharan Singh as Chief Digital Officer, HR Jagannath as Vice President (Engineering), and Vishesh Khanna as Vice President (Sales). The airline is planning to restart operations in July-September quarter.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: India committed to continue with radical reforms: NITI Aayog CEO
text: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant on Monday said India is committed to continue implementing radical reforms and that it will make it a leader in global economy. He added that the emergence of unicorns in the country even at the peak of COVID-19  pandemic has been phenomenal. Kant was speaking on the sidelines of the WEF Annual Meeting 2023.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: 15% export tax may force steel firms to cancel EU orders: JSPL MD
text: The 15% export tax imposed on eight steel products by the government could force steel companies to cancel European orders and suffer losses, Jindal Steel and Power's (JSPL) Managing Director VR Sharma told Reuters. "[Govt] should've given us...at least 2-3 months of time," Sharma added. He further said that Indian steelmakers have about 2 million tonnes in pending export orders.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Govt likely to stick to fiscal deficit target: RBI Governor
text: There may not necessarily be a need for the government to increase borrowing just yet and the Centre is likely to stick to its fiscal deficit target as specified in Budget 2022, said RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das. "There's no...co-relation between increase in government expenditure...and the need for additional borrowing. These are...figures which keep moving throughout the year," Das added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rising oil prices pose risk of global recession: IEA Executive Director
text: International Energy Agency (IEA) Executive Director Fatih Birol said oil producers need to act responsibly to help rein in oil prices, otherwise there's a risk of global recession. "If we don't make a positive contribution here, we may see prices even going higher...becoming a major risk for recession for the global economy," Birol said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt to cut central excise duty on petrol by ₹8 per litre, diesel by ₹6 per litre
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the government will reduce central excise duty on petrol and diesel by ₹8 and ₹6 per litre, respectively. She said, "This will reduce the price of petrol by ₹9.5 per litre and of diesel by ₹7 per litre." She also announced a subsidy of ₹200 per gas cylinder to beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: What announcements has the govt made amid inflation?
text: Amid inflation, government announced measures to help relieve the common man. "This year, we'll give subsidy of ₹200 per gas cylinder (upto 12 cylinders) to over 9 crore beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana," said government. "We're reducing customs duty on raw materials and intermediaries for plastic products...Import duty on some raw materials of steel will be reduced," it added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Petrol and diesel prices reduced after remaining unchanged for 45 days
text: Prices of petrol and diesel have been reduced after remaining unchanged for 45 days. This comes after the government reduced central excise duty on petrol and diesel. Petrol price in Delhi has been reduced from ₹105.41/litre to ₹96.72/litre. Meanwhile, diesel in Delhi now costs ₹89.62/litre. Petrol in Mumbai and Kolkata now costs ₹111.35/litre and ₹106.03/litre, respectively.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Infosys reappoints Salil Parekh as MD, CEO for 5 years
text: Infosys on Sunday said that its board has reappointed Salil Parekh as Managing Director and CEO for five more years, from July 1, 2022, to March 31, 2027. Parekh has been holding both posts since 2018 and was previously a member of the Group Executive Board at Capgemini, where he held several leadership positions for 25 years.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Stock market turmoil, crypto craze reminders of human fear and greed: CEA
text: India's Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran said that the recent turmoil and volatility in the stock market and the craze with which people are investing in crypto assets are "reminders that humans are still driven by fear and greed". He added, "Sometimes technology accentuates [fear and greed], rather than eliminating them."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk, stop horsing around & close this Twitter deal: YouTube Co-founder
text: YouTube Co-founder Chad Hurley tweeted to Tesla CEO Elon Musk, "Stop horsing around and close this Twitter deal. We all want a happy ending!" Apparently referring to the recent allegations of him offering to buy a horse for a flight attendant in exchange for an erotic massage, Musk replied, "Fine, if you touch my wiener, you can have a horse."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Very suspicious: Musk as Twitter refuses to explain calculation of fake accounts
text: World's richest person Elon Musk said it is "very suspicious" that Twitter is refusing to explain how it calculates that 5% of its daily users are fake or spam. He also agreed with a Twitter user who said that if 25% of Twitter users are bots, then the acquisition deal, which was priced at $44 billion, should cost 25% less.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Apple may expand production in India amid tight COVID-19 norms in China: Report
text: Apple has reportedly instructed several of its contract manufacturers that it is looking to expand production outside of China amid its tight COVID-19 restrictions. According to The Wall Street Journal, India and Vietnam, that account for a minority of Apple's global production, are being considered for this. It also said Apple is speaking to existing Indian suppliers regarding the expansion.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Cryptos are worth nothing, based on nothing: European Central Bank chief
text: European Central Bank's President Christine Lagarde said, "My very humble assessment is that it (cryptocurrency) is worth nothing, it is based on nothing, there is no underlying asset to act as an anchor of safety." Stating that she's concerned about people who have no understanding of the risks related to cryptocurrencies, Lagarde said that cryptocurrencies should be regulated.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sitharaman compares development spendings before & after 2014 after fuel price cut
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman clarified that the burden of recent petrol and diesel price cut will be borne by the Centre and compared developmental expenditure incurred by governments before and after 2014. "Expenditure incurred by the [Narendra Modi-led] govt during 2014-22 was ₹90.9 lakh crore...Only ₹49.2 lakh crore was spent on developmental expenditure during 2004-14," she stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Congress compares excise duty on petrol and diesel in May 2014 and now
text: After the Centre reduced excise duty on fuel, Congress compared the excise duty in May 2014 and now. Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala tweeted that excise duty on petrol in May 2014 was ₹9.48/litre and it is ₹19.90/litre now after Centre's duty cut. Surjewala added that excise duty on diesel was ₹3.56/litre and it is ₹15.80/litre after the tax cut.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: I am an electrical engineer, didn’t think of launching a makeup brand: SUGAR CEO
text: SUGAR Cosmetics CEO Vineeta Singh took to LinkedIn to share how she launched her brand while being an electrical engineer and with no experience with makeup. "I didn’t think of launching a makeup brand…Kaushik Mukherjee [her husband] and I started something else and it failed and it was our customers who literally took us down this road," she said.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Entire burden of excise duty cuts on petrol, diesel is borne by Centre: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday tweeted that the entire burden of the duty cuts on petrol and diesel announced yesterday and in November 2021 is being borne by the Centre. "Excise duty reduction...has entirely been made in Road & Infrastructure Cess," Sitharaman explained, adding that the Basic Excise Duty, which is sharable with the states, has not been touched.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: It's always people first for us: PM Modi as govt cuts excise duty on petrol, diesel
text: PM Narendra Modi tweeted "it's always people first for us" after the government announced measures to help the common man, including reduced excise duty on petrol and diesel. PM said, "Today's decisions...will positively impact various sectors, provide relief to our citizens and further 'Ease of Living'." Petrol and diesel prices will be cut by ₹9.5 and ₹7 per litre, respectively.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: China increases discounted Russian oil purchases by nearly 50%: Report
text: China is increasing its purchases of discounted Russian oil, as per shipping data and oil traders. While China had initially refused oil contracts with Russia due to the Ukraine war, it is projected to import 1.1 million barrels per day in May, about 47% up from 750,000 bpd in the first quarter, according to data accessed by Reuters.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Russians to be absent from WEF in Davos for first time since fall of communism
text: Russian oligarchs and companies will be absent from the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos this year amid the invasion of Ukraine. This will mark the first time since the fall of communism that the WEF will be held without Russian officials or business leaders, Bloomberg reported. The WEF will be held in-person for the first time in two years.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Air India bans smoking, consumption of intoxicating substances at workplace
text: Tata Group-run Air India has banned smoking and consumption of intoxicating substances at the workplace. In a letter to staff, Air India's CHRO Suresh Dutt Tripathi wrote that Air India is a responsible organisation which aims to provide a safe and healthy work environment. "We have zero-tolerance for violations...Any violation...will be dealt with appropriate consequences," Tripathi further said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: PNB earns over ₹645 crore through ATM transaction charges in FY 2021-2022
text: Punjab National Bank has earned over ₹645 crore through ATM transaction charges levied on customers during the financial year 2021-22, the bank revealed while responding to an RTI. PNB also said that it collected ₹239.09 crore in the form of penalties imposed on customers who failed to maintain a minimum balance or quarterly/monthly average balance in their bank accounts.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Sun Pharma recalls 10,548 bottles of anti-depression drug in US
text: India's largest drugmaker Sun Pharma is recalling 10,548 bottles of bupropion hydrochloride extended-release tablets, a generic anti-depression drug, in the US market. As per the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA), a customer found a "dark, gritty substance" inside one bottle. The affected lot of the medication was manufactured by Sun Pharma in its manufacturing plant in Gujarat's Halol.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Better than nothing: Pawar over excise duty cut on petrol, diesel
text: After the government reduced the excise duty on petrol and diesel, NCP chief Sharad Pawar said, "It is better than nothing." Notably, PM Narendra Modi-led government on Saturday cut excise duty on petrol and diesel by ₹8 and ₹6 per litre, respectively. This will reduce the price of petrol by ₹9.5 per litre and of diesel by ₹7 per litre.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Opposition-ruled states should also reduce fuel rates: BJP's Nadda
text: After the government reduced the excise duty on petrol and diesel, BJP chief JP Nadda said that Opposition should also reduce fuel rates in the states governed by them so that the common people can get some relief amid inflation. The excise duty cut will reduce the petrol and diesel prices by ₹9.5 per litre and ₹7 per litre, respectively.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Ford's internet-linked cars face nationwide sales ban in Germany
text: A German court has put a nationwide sales and production ban on Ford cars that are able to establish an internet connection, in a case over violation of wireless technology patents. The verdict is not legally binding and can still be appealed. The plaintiff, Japan's IP Bridge, needs to make a $240-million security payment for it to become "provisionally enforceable".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Expecting RBI to lift curbs in 3 to 5 months: Paytm Payments Bank
text: Paytm Payments Bank expects the RBI to lift the curbs it put on the company in the next three to five months, Paytm's Group CFO Madhur Deora told Reuters. In March, RBI ordered a comprehensive audit of the bank's IT systems and barred it from taking on new customers citing "material" supervisory concerns. The bank is assisting RBI, Reuters reported.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: FPIs remain net sellers, withdraw ₹35,137 crore between May 2-20
text: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹35,137 crore during May 2-20, data with depositories showed. After turning net investors for the first time in six months between April 1-8, FPIs turned net sellers again during April 11-13 week and have remained negative since then. The net outflow of FPIs from equities has reached ₹1.63 lakh crore so far in 2022.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Will consider further cut: K'taka CM after Centre reduces fuel prices
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday said the state government "will consider" further cut in fuel tax. His statement comes after the Centre on Saturday announced a ₹8 per litre cut in excise duty on petrol and ₹6 per litre on diesel. "I thank honourable PM Narendra Modi...This is a pro-people decision," Bommai had tweeted following the announcement.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: NCLAT rejects Hinduja Leyland Finance's insolvency plea against Fly Express
text: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has dismissed the plea of Hinduja Leyland Finance Ltd to initiate insolvency proceedings against its creditor Fly Express Logistics. This comes after the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) rejected the plea in April, saying the date of default, December 24, 2022, falls within prohibition period mentioned in the Insolvency & Bankruptcy Code.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: No support from govt needed this fiscal: Punjab & Sind Bank MD
text: Punjab & Sind Bank is sufficiently capitalised to meet expected credit growth in the current fiscal year and may not need support from the government, MD and CEO S Krishnan said. He added that the bank's capital adequacy ratio improved to 18.54% in March 2022 from 17.06% in March 2021. During FY22, the government infused ₹4,600 crore in the bank.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Delhi govt raises DA for labourers, claims highest minimum wages in India
text: Delhi government on Friday raised the dearness allowance (DA) for labourers amid rising inflation. With this, the monthly wages for unskilled labourers have been raised from ₹16,064 to ₹16,506 and semi-skilled labourers' wages have been increased from ₹17,693 to ₹18,187 per month. "Minimum wages in Delhi are highest in comparison to any other state," Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia claimed.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's annual FDI inflow hits all-time high of $83.57 billion in 2021-22
text: India's annual FDI (foreign direct investment) inflow hit an all-time high of $83.57 billion in the financial year 2021-22, the Ministry of Commerce & Industry said on Friday. The Ministry said that the highest-ever annual FDI inflow has been recorded despite military operation in Ukraine and COVID-19 pandemic. In 2020-21, the FDI inflow in India stood at $81.97 billion.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: CBI raids brokers in Delhi, Mumbai & other cities in NSE co-location scam case
text: The CBI on Saturday carried out a coordinated search operation at over 10 locations in multiple cities in connection with the NSE co-location scam case. The searches will cover brokers at more than 12 premises in Mumbai, Delhi and Kolkata, among others. Notably, CBI has filed a chargesheet against former NSE CEO and MD Chitra Ramkrishna in the case.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Jet Airways gets DGCA nod to resume flight operations after 3 years
text: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has granted the air operator's certificate (AOC) to Jet Airways, allowing the grounded carrier to resume commercial flight operations after three years. The airline successfully conducted all its proving flights, reportedly with DGCA officials onboard, this week. Earlier, the Ministry of Home Affairs had granted security clearance to Jet Airways.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla building hardcore litigation dept: Musk after sexual harassment claims
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted that Tesla is building a "hardcore litigation department", a day after a report accused him of sexually harassing a flight attendant in 2016. He added that while the team will directly report to him, listing his commitments he wrote, "We'll never seek victory in a just case against us, even if we will probably win."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: ₹7.4 crore stolen from payment gateway Razorpay using 'failed transactions'
text: Hackers and fraudsters have stolen ₹7.38 crore by tampering with the authorisation process of 831 transactions on the payment gateway Razorpay, the company said in a police complaint. The company conducted an internal investigation after its authorisation and authentication partner Fiserv said the transactions had failed. The transactions had taken place from March 6 to May 13 this year.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Brazil's Bolsonaro meets Elon Musk, calls his $44 bn Twitter bid a 'breath of hope'
text: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro met the world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk in Brazil on Friday. Bolsonaro hailed Musk's $44 billion bid to acquire Twitter and said, "For us here it was like a breath of hope." They also talked about connectivity, investments, innovation and the use of technology to reinforce protection of the Amazon rainforest, Bolsonaro tweeted.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sexual harassment story meant to interfere with Twitter acquisition: Musk
text: After a report claimed Tesla CEO Elon Musk allegedly sexually harassed a flight attendant employed by SpaceX in 2016, he said that the story was meant to "interfere with the Twitter acquisition". Responding to a follower who asked if he responded to the writers of the story, Musk replied, "The story was written before they even talked to me."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Meta asks staff to not discuss abortion on internal chat due to 'increased risk'
text: A Meta executive asked employees to refrain from discussing abortion on Workplace, an internal social media platform, citing it as "an increased risk", as per a report. The top Meta executive also said abortion was "the most divisive and reported topic" by employees on Workplace. This comes after the US Supreme Court draft leak proposed abolishing abortion rights nationwide.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Can finally use 'Elongate' as scandal name: Musk amid sexual misconduct claims
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has tweeted, "Finally, we get to use Elongate as scandal name. It's kinda perfect." He quote-tweeted his own tweet from last year where he had suggested calling any scandal about him 'Elongate'. This comes after a report claimed that he allegedly sexually harassed a SpaceX flight attendant in 2016. Musk has called the claims "utterly untrue".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: I'm not a billionaire anymore: Ethereum's 28-yr-old Co-founder Buterin
text: Ethereum's 28-year-old Co-founder Vitalik Buterin on Friday tweeted that he is "not a billionaire anymore" after a massive sell-off in the cryptocurrency market recently. Buterin, who created Ethereum in 2014, became the world's youngest crypto billionaire last year. A digital wallet held by Buterin contained crypto holdings worth about $1.5 billion as recently as November, Bloomberg reported.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I've been receiving threats to life, family: Bose after Zilingo fires her as CEO
text: After Singapore-based B2B fashion startup Zilingo fired Ankiti Bose as CEO, Bose said she "will pursue our rights against this witch-hunt to the full extent of the law". She also said that she has been receiving online threats to her life and family. Zilingo had earlier suspended Bose on the basis of an anonymous whistleblower complaint over alleged financial irregularities.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Vijay Shekhar Sharma reappointed CEO and MD of Paytm for 5 years
text: Paytm on Saturday said that its board of Directors have approved the reappointment of Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma as Managing Director (MD) and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the company. Sharma's reappointment is effective for a tenure of 5 years till December 18, 2027. Further, Paytm's board has also approved the appointment of its CFO Madhur Deora as Whole-time Director.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Amazon, Flipkart in talks to buy stake in $1.1 bn Metropolis Healthcare: Report
text: Diagnostics chain Metropolis Healthcare is reportedly looking to raise over $300 million and bring onboard a strategic partner by selling a significant minority stake. While Flipkart and Apollo Hospitals are among potential investors, Amazon has held preliminary discussions, Bloomberg reported. Metropolis currently has a market value of $1.1 billion, about half of what it was at the start of 2022.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Paytm posts ₹762.5 cr loss in Q4, says 'on track to break-even by Sept 2023'
text: Paytm has reported a loss of ₹762.5 crore for the March quarter of the financial year 2021-22, up 72% from ₹444.4 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal. The company's revenue from operations were up by 89% year-on-year at ₹1,541 crore for the quarter. Paytm said it is "on track to achieve break-even by quarter ending September 2023".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RBI to transfer ₹30,307 crore as surplus to central government for 2021-22
text: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) board has approved the transfer of ₹30,307 crore as surplus to the central government for the accounting year 2021-22. It has further decided to maintain the Contingency Risk Buffer at 5.50%. The central bank's board also reviewed the current economic situation, global and domestic challenges and the impact of recent geopolitical developments.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: CNG prices hiked in Delhi-NCR by ₹2/kg to ₹75.61/kg; 2nd hike in 6 days
text: The Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) has hiked the price of CNG in Delhi-NCR by ₹2 per kg to ₹75.61 per kg. For Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad, the increased CNG prices are now ₹78.17 per kg, while in Gurugram, it will cost ₹83.94 per kg. Notably, this is the second such hike in six days.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Piyush Goyal to lead Indian delegation at World Economic Forum in Davos
text: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal will lead India's delegation of ministers and business leaders at the World Economic Forum in Davos from May 23-25. While the event took place virtually last year owing to the COVID-19 pandemic, the WEF was to be held earlier this year but was delayed to May due to the spread of the Omicron variant.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Rishi Sunak, wife Akshata enter 'UK Rich List' with combined £730 million wealth
text: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak and his wife Akshata Murty have been included in The Sunday Times Rich List of the UK's wealthiest 250 people for the first time. The couple has ranked 222nd on the list with a combined fortune of £730 million. Akshata Murty, the daughter of Infosys Founder NR Narayana Murthy, owns about 0.9% stake in Infosys.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Russia to cut natural gas supplies to Finland, days after it applied to join NATO
text: Russia will stop supplying natural gas to Finland after the country which applied for NATO membership recently, refused to pay for its supplies in roubles. Finnish state-owned energy firm Gasum confirmed the news. Natural gas accounts for about eight per cent of Finland's energy consumption, most of which comes from Russia.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Dominica withdraws case against Mehul Choksi over 'illegal entry'
text: Authorities in Dominica have discontinued the proceedings against fugitive businessman Mehul Choksi over his 'illegal entry' into the island nation, officials said on Saturday. Choksi, who is wanted in connection to the ₹13,500 crore Punjab National Bank fraud case, had claimed he was abducted from Antigua and Barbuda and taken to Dominica against his will.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: What are the key facts on Indian incomes revealed in State of Inequality report?
text: As per the latest State of Inequality in India report, the total earnings of the top 1% (₹1,27,48,00,000) were three times that of the total earnings of the bottom 10% (₹32,10,00,000). The top 1% accounted for 6-7% of the total income earned in India while the top 10% got 30-35%. The bottom 50% earned around 22% of total income.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: ₹25,000 monthly salary is among top 10% incomes earned in India: Report
text: A monthly salary of ₹25,000 is among the top 10% of incomes earned in India, The State of Inequality Report released by the Economic Advisory Council to the PM (EAC-PM) has said. Citing the 2018-19 and 2019-20 data from the Periodic Labour Force Survey, the report said nearly 15% of the working population earned less than ₹5,000 per month.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: US' economic growth poised to outpace China's for first time since 1976: Report
text: The economic growth of United States is poised to outpace China's for the first time this year since 1976, Bloomberg Economics wrote in a report. China, the world's second-largest economy, will grow just 2% in 2022 due to its Zero Covid policy, Bloomberg Economics reported. On the other hand, the US' gross domestic product (GDP) will increase 2.8%, it added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sensex jumps over 1,500 points to end at 54,326, Nifty closes above 16,250
text: The Sensex jumped 1,534 points or 2.91% to close at 54,326, while the broader Nifty climbed 456 points to settle above 16,250 on Friday. The benchmark indices rallied as Asian stocks jumped after China cut a key lending benchmark to support a slowing economy. All sectoral indices ended in the green with metal, pharma, and realty indices up 3-4% each.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Hindujas top 2022 UK Rich List with £28 billion fortune, Lakshmi Mittal ranks 6th
text: Srichand and Gopichand Hinduja and family have topped The Sunday Times UK Rich List 2022 with a fortune of £28.472 billion. They are followed by Sir James Dyson who has a net worth of £23 billion and Mumbai-born property investor brothers David and Simon Reuben with £22.265 billion wealth. Lakshmi Niwas Mittal ranks 6th on the list with £17 billion.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Maruti to set up third Haryana plant, project to create 11,000 jobs
text: Maruti Suzuki India Limited (MSIL) will set up a new plant in Haryana's Kharkhoda which is going to be the automaker's third plant in the state. "Maruti Suzuki purchased land in Kharkhoda due to the better environment in the state," MSIL Chairman RC Bhargava said. Maruti's new project will reportedly create 11,000 jobs and will cost ₹18,000 crore.
author: Subhangi Singh
